text:
For the ThreadGroup element, if you enter a non-numeric in the "Number of 
Threads" field, a java.lang.NumberFormatException error is thrown.
creator: khammond25@home.com
khammond25@home.com
text:
Also, a java.lang.NumberFormatException can be thrown when editing the field.

For example, enter 5 in the "Number of Threads" field. Next, use the BACKSPACE 
key to delete 5 and enter 3.  When you deleted 5, the field was automatically 
converted to a number.  Of course, the field was empty because we just deleted 
the 5. So, an exception was thrown.

creator: khammond25@home.com
text:
Also, if you enter a number that exceeds the maximum allowable integer, you get 
a java.lang.NumberFormatException.

text:
The two patches fix all parts of this bug.  Additionally, a dialog is displayed 
if the user enters an invalid number.  With the patches for this bug and bug 
#3682, the entire ThreadGroup Control Panel has a consistent behavior and is 
much firendlier to the user!

Patch for ThreadGroup
---------------------
I added default "number of threads" and "ramp up".  This way, if the gui 
detects an invalid number, it can ask the ThreadGroup for the default value.

Patch for ThreadGroupGui
------------------------
Catch NumberFormatException and inform user of error in a dialog.
